intro: Tremastelma sibthorpii, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has a creeping growth habit, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
